thread.title: Seattle Seahawks snap counts vs. 49ers: Starting defenders get lots of work
thread.title_full: Seattle Seahawks snap counts vs. 49ers: Starting defenders get lots of work | The Seattle Times

author: Bob Condotta
title: Seattle Seahawks snap counts vs. 49ers: Starting defenders get lots of work
text:
Below are the snap counts for the Seattle Seahawks in their 20-3 win over the 49ers Thursday might (the asterisk denotes the player is a starter).
A couple thoughts:
— Will Tukuafu got a season-high 26 snaps as a fullback, and Pro Football Focus further broke down where he lined up:
TE – 4 (all of which were on the right) FB – 9 FB offset left – 6 FB offset right – 7 So that’s 22 plays when the Seahawks were essentially in an I-formation/two-back set, on a night when the Seahawks indeed felt back to basics with a 41-24 run-pass ratio. Tukuafu also had four snaps on defense, playing on the line. — A high concentration of snaps in the team’s primary defenders with six playing every snap, Cary Williams all but one in which he left due to injury, and two others 80 percent or more. Some national analysts wondered last week if the Seahawks were getting away from their philosophy of being fairly basic and straight-up on defense. The snap counts would indicate that if they had, they got back to their usual ways last night. Recall that the Seahawks also had high snap count percentages for their main defensive players during the six-game winning streak that ended last season. (As Eric Branch noted , the Seahawks got five of their six sacks out of a four-man rush). — Alvin Bailey with 24 snaps and Gary Gilliam with 52 as the two rotated at right tackle (with Bailey also getting one snap at left tackle when Russell Okung missed one play and a couple more as an extra tackle). That was done largely due to Gilliam’s ankle injury. — DeShawn Shead with 20 snaps which amounted to 19 in the nickel and then one when he filled in for Williams when Williams was hurt for a play — probably as little nickel as the Seahawks have played this season. Sweezy * 72 Russell Wilson * 72 Russell Okung * 70 Garry Gilliam * 52 Jimmy Graham * 50 Doug Baldwin * 49 Jermaine Kearse * 45 Marshawn Lynch * 40 Tyler Lockett 40 Luke Willson * 34 Will Tukuafu 26 Alvin Bailey 24 Ricardo Lockette 23 Fred Jackson 18 Chris Matthews 15 Thomas Rawls 11 B.J. Daniels 4 Cooper Helfet 3

Wright * 48 Kam Chancellor * 48 Earl Thomas * 48 Richard Sherman * 48 Cary Williams * 47 Cliff Avril * 41 Michael Bennett * 37 Brandon Mebane * 29 Frank Clark 23 DeShawn Shead 20 Ahtyba Rubin * 15 David King 14 Cassius Marsh 10 Will Tukuafu (Def.) 4 Bob Condotta : 206-515-5699 or bcondotta@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @bcondotta . Bob Condotta covers the Seahawks for the Seattle Times. He provides daily coverage of the team throughout the year.
